tags.name: Compliance
tags.description: Endpoints related to keeping Twitter data in your systems compliant

tags.name: General
tags.description: Miscellaneous endpoints for general API functionality

tags.name: Lists
tags.description: Endpoints related to retrieving, managing Lists

tags.name: Spaces
tags.description: Endpoints related to retrieving, managing Spaces

tags.name: Tweets
tags.description: Endpoints related to retrieving, searching, and modifying Tweets

tags.name: Users
tags.description: Endpoints related to retrieving, managing relationships of Users

get.description: This endpoint returns information about users. Specify users by their ID.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Required. A list of User IDs, comma-separated. You can specify up to 100 IDs.

get.description: This endpoint returns information about a user. Specify user by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Required. A User ID.

get.description: This endpoint returns information about users. Specify users by their username.

parameters.name: usernames
parameters.description: Required . A list of usernames, comma-separated. You can specify up to 100 usernames.

get.description: This endpoint returns information about the requesting user.
This endpoint returns information about a user. Specify user by username.

parameters.name: username
parameters.description: Required. A username.

post.description: Causes the user (in the path) to block the target user. The user (in the path) must match the user context authorizing the request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user that is requesting to block the target user

get.summary: Returns user objects that are blocked by provided user ID
get.description: Returns a list of users that are blocked by the provided user ID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user for whom to return results

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This value is populated by passing the 'next_token' or 'previous_token' returned in a request to paginate through results.

delete.description: Causes the source user to unblock the target user. The source user must match the user context authorizing the request

parameters.name: source_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user that is requesting to unblock the target user

parameters.name: target_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user that the source user is requesting to unblock

delete.description: Causes the source user to unmute the target user. The source user must match the user context authorizing the request

parameters.name: source_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user that is requesting to unmute the target user

parameters.name: target_user_id
parameters.description: The ID of the user that the source user is requesting to unmute

post.description: Causes the user (in the path) to mute the target user. The user (in the path) must match the user context authorizing the request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user that is requesting to mute the target user

get.description: Returns a list of users that are muted by the provided user ID

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

post.description: Causes the user(in the path) to follow, or “request to follow” for protected users, the target user. The user(in the path) must match the user context authorizing the request

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the user that is requesting to follow the target user

parameters.name: id

get.description: Returns a variety of information about the Tweet specified by the requested ID.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma separated list of Tweet IDs. Up to 100 are allowed in a single request.

post.description: Causes the user to create a tweet under the authorized account.

direct_message_deep_link.description: Link to take the conversation from the public timeline to a private Direct Message.

quote_tweet_id.description: Link to the Tweet being quoted. This is mutually exclusive from Poll and Media.

reply.description: Tweet information of the Tweet being replied to.

exclude_reply_user_ids.description: A list of User Ids to be excluded from the reply Tweet.

media.description: Media information being attached to created Tweet. This is mutually exclusive from Quote Tweet Id and Poll.

media_ids.description: A list of Media Ids to be attached to a created Tweet.

tagged_user_ids.description: A list of User Ids to be tagged in the media for created Tweet.

poll.description: Poll options for a Tweet with a poll. This is mutually exclusive from Media and Quote Tweet Id.

reply_settings.description: Settings to indicate who can reply to the Tweet.

geo.description: Place ID being attached to the Tweet for geo location.

get.description: Returns a variety of information about the Tweet specified by the requested ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: A single Tweet ID.

delete.description: Delete specified Tweet (in the path) by ID.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the Tweet to be deleted.

put.description: Hides or unhides a reply to an owned conversation.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The ID of the reply that you want to hide or unhide.

200.description: A successful response. The reply has been hidden or unhidden.

get.description: Returns Tweets from the last 7 days that match a search query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Tweets. Up to 512 characters.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp (from most recent 7 days) from which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute).

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute).

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to be returned by a request.

parameters.name: next_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified.

get.description: Returns Tweets that match a search query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Tweets. Up to 1024 characters.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp from which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute).

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute).

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of search results to be returned by a request.

parameters.name: next_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified.

get.description: Streams Tweets matching the stream's active rule set.

200.description: The request was successful. Successful responses will return a stream of individual JSON Tweet payloads.

get.description: Returns rules from a user's active rule set. Users can fetch all of their rules or a subset, specified by the provided rule ids.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of Rule IDs.

parameters.name: max_results
parameters.description: The maximum number of results

parameters.name: pagination_token
parameters.description: This value is populated by passing the 'next_token' returned in a request to paginate through results.

post.description: Add or delete rules from a user's active rule set. Users can provide unique, optionally tagged rules to add. Users can delete their entire rule set or a subset specified by rule ids or values.

parameters.name: dry_run
parameters.description: Dry Run can be used with both the add and delete action, with the expected result given, but without actually taking any action in the system (meaning the end state will always be as it was when the request was submitted). This is particularly useful to validate rule changes.

get.description: Streams a deterministic 1% of public Tweets.

200.description: The request was successful. Successful responses will return a stream of individual JSON Tweet payloads.

get.summary: Returns the open api spec document.
get.description: Full open api spec in JSON format. (See https://github.com/OAI/OpenAPI-Specification/blob/master/README.md)

get.description: Returns Tweet Counts from the last 7 days that match a search query.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: One query/rule/filter for matching Tweets. Up to 2048 characters.

parameters.name: start_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The oldest UTC timestamp (from most recent 7 days) from which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is inclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 includes the first second of the minute).

parameters.name: end_time
parameters.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The newest, most recent UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. Timestamp is in second granularity and is exclusive (i.e. 12:00:01 excludes the first second of the minute).

parameters.name: since_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID greater than (that is, more recent than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: until_id
parameters.description: Returns results with a Tweet ID less than (that is, older than) the specified ID.

parameters.name: next_token
parameters.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results. The value used with the parameter is pulled directly from the response provided by the API, and should not be modified.

parameters.name: granularity
parameters.description: The granularity for the search counts results.

scopes.tweet.read: Allows the app to view any Tweets the authenticated user can see, including Tweets from protected accounts.
scopes.tweet.write: Allows the app to tweet and retweet for the authenticated user.
scopes.users.read: Allows the app to view any account the authenticated user can see, including protected accounts.
scopes.list.write: Allows the app to create and manage lists for the authenticated user.
scopes.list.read: Allows the app to view any lists the authenticated user has created and lists they are a member of, including private lists.
scopes.like.read: Allows the app to read Tweets that the authenticated user has liked.
scopes.like.write: Allows the app to like and un-likes Tweets for the authenticated user.
scopes.mute.read: Allows the app to read the users the authenticated user has muted.
scopes.mute.write: Allows the app to mute and unmute users for the authenticated user.
scopes.block.read: Allows the app to read the users the authenticated user has blocked.
scopes.block.write: Allows the app to block and unblock users for the authenticated user.
scopes.tweet.moderate.write: Allows the app to hide and unhide replies to the authenticated user's Tweets.
scopes.follows.read: Allows the app to read the users who follow the authenticated user and users that they follow.
scopes.follows.write: Allows the app to follow and unfollow users for the authenticated user.
scopes.space.read: Allows the app to read the Spaces the authenticated user can see.
scopes.offline.access: Allows the app to request a refresh token.

MediaHeight.description: The height of the media in pixels

MediaWidth.description: The width of the media in pixels

ContextAnnotation.description: Annotation inferred from the tweet text.

ContextAnnotationDomainFields.description: Represents the data for the context annotation domain.

id.description: The unique id for a context annotation domain.

name.description: Name of the context annotation domain.

description.description: Description of the context annotation domain.

ContextAnnotationEntityFields.description: Represents the data for the context annotation entity.

id.description: The unique id for a context annotation entity.

name.description: Name of the context annotation entity.

description.description: Description of the context annotation entity.

EntityIndicesInclusiveExclusive.description: Represent a boundary range (start and end index) for a recognized entity (for example a hashtag or a mention). `start` must be smaller than `end`.  The start index is inclusive, the end index is exclusive.

start.description: Index (zero-based) at which position this entity starts.  The index is inclusive.

end.description: Index (zero-based) at which position this entity ends.  The index is exclusive.

EntityIndicesInclusiveInclusive.description: Represent a boundary range (start and end index) for a recognized entity (for example a hashtag or a mention). `start` must be smaller than `end`.  The start index is inclusive, the end index is inclusive.

start.description: Index (zero-based) at which position this entity starts.  The index is inclusive.

end.description: Index (zero-based) at which position this entity ends.  The index is inclusive.

URLFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a URL.

display_url.description: The URL as displayed in the Twitter client.

title.description: Title of the page the URL points to.
title.example: Introducing the v2 follow lookup endpoints

description.description: Description of the URL landing page.
description.example: This is a description of the website.

UrlEntity.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a URL, and its start and end position within the text.

URLImage.description: Represent the information for the URL image

HashtagFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a Hashtag, and its start and end position within the text.

CashtagFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a Cashtag, and its start and end position within the text.

MentionFields.description: Represent the portion of text recognized as a User mention, and its start and end position within the text.

TweetID.description: Unique identifier of this Tweet. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.

TweetText.example: Learn how to use the user Tweet timeline and user mention timeline endpoints in the Twitter API v2 to explore Tweet\u2026 https:\/\/t.co\/56a0vZUx7i

UserID.description: Unique identifier of this User. This is returned as a string in order to avoid complications with languages and tools that cannot handle large integers.

SpaceID.description: The unique identifier of this Space.

ReplySettings.description: Shows who can reply a Tweet. Fields returned are everyone, mentioned_users, and following.

referenced_tweets.description: A list of Tweets this Tweet refers to. For example, if the parent Tweet is a Retweet, a Quoted Tweet or a Reply, it will include the related Tweet referenced to by its parent.

attachments.description: Specifies the type of attachments (if any) present in this Tweet.

media_keys.description: A list of Media Keys for each one of the media attachments (if media are attached).

poll_ids.description: A list of poll IDs (if polls are attached).

geo.description: The location tagged on the Tweet, if the user provided one.

public_metrics.description: Engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

reply_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.

like_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.

quote_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been quoted.

possibly_sensitive.description: Indicates if this Tweet contains URLs marked as sensitive, for example content suitable for mature audiences.

lang.description: Language of the Tweet, if detected by Twitter. Returned as a BCP47 language tag.

source.description: The name of the app the user Tweeted from.

non_public_metrics.description: Nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

impression_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.

promoted_metrics.description: Promoted nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

impression_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.

like_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.

reply_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

organic_metrics.description: Organic nonpublic engagement metrics for the Tweet at the time of the request.

impression_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been viewed.

retweet_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been Retweeted.

reply_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been replied to.

like_count.description: Number of times this Tweet has been liked.

example.text: Learn how to use the user Tweet timeline and user mention timeline endpoints in the Twitter API v2 to explore Tweet\u2026 https:\/\/t.co\/56a0vZUx7i

name.description: The friendly name of this user, as shown on their profile.

protected.description: Indicates if this user has chosen to protect their Tweets (in other words, if this user's Tweets are private).

verified.description: Indicate if this user is a verified Twitter User.

profile_image_url.description: The URL to the profile image for this user.

location.description: The location specified in the user's profile, if the user provided one. As this is a freeform value, it may not indicate a valid location, but it may be fuzzily evaluated when performing searches with location queries.

url.description: The URL specified in the user's profile.

description.description: The text of this user's profile description (also known as bio), if the user provided one.

entities.description: A list of metadata found in the user's profile description.

url.description: Expanded details for the URL specified in the user's profile, with start and end indices.

public_metrics.description: A list of metrics for this user

followers_count.description: Number of users who are following this user.

following_count.description: Number of users this user is following.

tweet_count.description: The number of Tweets (including Retweets) posted by this user.

listed_count.description: The number of lists that include this user.

UserName.description: The Twitter handle (screen name) of this user.

name.description: The human readable name of this place.

full_name.description: The full name of this place.

country.description: The full name of the county in which this place exists.

Poll.description: Represent a Poll attached to a Tweet

PollOption.description: Describes a choice in a Poll object.

position.description: Position of this choice in the poll.

votes.description: Number of users who voted for this choice.

PollOptionLabel.description: The text of a poll choice.

DurationMinutes.description: Duration of the poll in minutes.

List.description: A Twitter List is a curated group of accounts.

ListID.description: The unique identifier of this List.

result_count.description: The number of list results returned in this response
The number of list results returned in this response

MediaId.description: The unique identifier of this Media.

public_metrics.description: Engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

view_count.description: Number of times this video has been viewed.

non_public_metrics.description: Nonpublic engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

playback_0_count.description: Number of users who made it through 0% of the video.

playback_25_count.description: Number of users who made it through 25% of the video.

playback_50_count.description: Number of users who made it through 50% of the video.

playback_75_count.description: Number of users who made it through 75% of the video.

playback_100_count.description: Number of users who made it through 100% of the video.

organic_metrics.description: Organic nonpublic engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

playback_0_count.description: Number of users who made it through 0% of the video.

playback_25_count.description: Number of users who made it through 25% of the video.

playback_50_count.description: Number of users who made it through 50% of the video.

playback_75_count.description: Number of users who made it through 75% of the video.

playback_100_count.description: Number of users who made it through 100% of the video.

view_count.description: Number of times this video has been viewed.

promoted_metrics.description: Promoted nonpublic engagement metrics for the Media at the time of the request.

playback_0_count.description: Number of users who made it through 0% of the video.

playback_25_count.description: Number of users who made it through 25% of the video.

playback_50_count.description: Number of users who made it through 50% of the video.

playback_75_count.description: Number of users who made it through 75% of the video.

playback_100_count.description: Number of users who made it through 100% of the video.

view_count.description: Number of times this video has been viewed.

MediaKey.description: The Media Key identifier for this attachment.

copyright.description: Indicates if the content is being withheld for on the basis of copyright infringement.

country_codes.description: Provides a list of countries where this content is not available.

scope.description: Indicates whether the content being withheld is the `tweet` or a `user`.

country_codes.description: Provides a list of countries where this content is not available.

scope.description: Indicates that the content being withheld is a `user`.

CountryCode.description: A two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code

GenericProblem.description: A generic problem with no additional information beyond that provided by the HTTP status code.

InvalidRequestProblem.description: A problem that indicates this request is invalid.

ResourceNotFoundProblem.description: A problem that indicates that a given Tweet, User, etc. does not exist.

value.description: Value will match the schema of the field.

ResourceUnauthorizedProblem.description: A problem that indicates you are not allowed to see a particular Tweet, User, etc.

ResourceUnavailableProblem.description: A problem that indicates a particular Tweet, User, etc. is not available to you.

FieldUnauthorizedProblem.description: A problem that indicates that you are not allowed to see a particular field on a Tweet, User, etc.

ClientForbiddenProblem.description: A problem that indicates your client is forbidden from making this request.

DisallowedResourceProblem.description: A problem that indicates that the resource requested violates the precepts of this API.

UnsupportedAuthenticationProblem.description: A problem that indicates that the authentication used is not supported.

UsageCapExceededProblem.description: A problem that indicates that a usage cap has been exceeded.

ConnectionExceptionProblem.description: A problem that indicates something is wrong with the connection

OperationalDisconnectProblem.description: You have been disconnected for operational reasons.

RulesCapProblem.description: You have exceeded the maximum number of rules.

InvalidRuleProblem.description: The rule you have submitted is invalid.

DuplicateRuleProblem.description: The rule you have submitted is a duplicate.

ConflictProblem.description: You cannot create a new job if one is already in progress.

NonCompliantRulesProblem.description: A problem that indicates the user's rule set is not compliant.

Problem.description: An HTTP Problem Details object, as defined in IETF RFC 7807 (https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7807).

newest_id.description: Most recent Tweet Id returned by search query

oldest_id.description: Oldest Tweet Id returned by search query

next_token.description: This value is used to get the next 'page' of results by providing it to the next_token parameter.

StreamingTweet.description: A tweet or error that can be returned by the streaming tweet API.

FilteredStreamingTweet.description: A tweet or error that can be returned by the streaming tweet API

oneOf.description: The values returned with a successful streamed tweet. Includes the user provided rules that the tweet matched.

matching_rules.description: The list of rules which matched the tweet

tag.description: The user-supplied tag assigned to the rule which matched

RuleTag.description: A tag meant for the labeling of user provided rules.

RuleValue.description: The filterlang value of the rule.

oneOf.description: A summary of the results of the addition of user-specified stream filtering rules.

created.description: Number of user-specified stream filtering rules that were created.

not_created.description: Number of user-specified stream filtering rules that were not created.

valid.description: Number of valid user-specified stream filtering rules.

invalid.description: Number of invalid user-specified stream filtering rules.

deleted.description: Number of user-specified stream filtering rules that were deleted.

not_deleted.description: Number of user-specified stream filtering rules that were not deleted.

AddRulesRequest.description: A request to add a user-specified stream filtering rule.

AddRulesResponse.description: A response from adding user-specified stream filtering rules.

data.description: All user-specified stream filtering rules that were created.

DeleteRulesRequest.description: A response from deleting user-specified stream filtering rules.

delete.description: IDs and values of all deleted user-specified stream filtering rules.

ids.description: IDs of all deleted user-specified stream filtering rules.

values.description: Values of all deleted user-specified stream filtering rules.

newest_id.description: Newest Tweet ID in the result set

oldest_id.description: Oldest Tweet ID in the result set

result_count.description: Number of Tweets in result set
The number of user results returned in this response
The number of user results returned in this response
The number of user results returned in this response

next_token.description: This value is used to get the next 'page' of results by providing it to the next_token parameter.

total_tweet_count.description: Sum of search query count results

Start.description: The start time of the bucket

End.description: The end time of the bucket

CreatedAt.description: Creation time of the compliance job.

UploadUrl.description: URL to which the user will upload their tweet or user IDs

DownloadUrl.description: URL from which the user will retrieve their compliance results

UploadExpiration.description: Expiration time of the upload URL

DownloadExpiration.description: Expiration time of the download URL

ComplianceJobName.description: User-provided name for a compliance job

ComplianceJobType.description: Type of compliance job to list.

state.description: The current state of the space.

started_at.description: When the space was started as a date string

is_ticketed.description: Denotes if the space is a ticketed space

participant_count.description: The number of participants in a space

host_ids.description: The user ids for the hosts of the space

updated_at.description: When the space was last updated

speaker_ids.description: An array of user ids for people who were speakers in a space

invited_user_ids.description: An array of user ids for people who were invited to a space

scheduled_start.description: A date time stamp for when a space is scheduled to begin

topics.description: The topics of a space, as selected by its creator

id.description: An ID suitable for use in the REST API.

description.description: The description of the given topic.

name.description: The name of the given topic.

MaxResults.description: The number of results to return

TweetExpansionsParameter.name: expansions
TweetExpansionsParameter.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.

schema.description: The list of fields you can expand for a [Tweet](#Tweet) object. If the field has an ID, it can be expanded into a full object.

SpaceFieldsParameter.name: space.fields
SpaceFieldsParameter.description: A comma separated list of Space fields to display.

schema.description: The fields available for a Space object.

UserExpansionsParameter.name: expansions
UserExpansionsParameter.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.

schema.description: The list of fields you can expand for a [User](#User) object. If the field has an ID, it can be expanded into a full object.

SpaceExpansionsParameter.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.

schema.description: The list of fields you can expand for a [Space](#Space) object. If the field has an ID, it can be expanded into a full object.

ListExpansionsParameter.name: expansions
ListExpansionsParameter.description: A comma separated list of fields to expand.

schema.description: The list of fields you can expand for a [List](#List) object. If the field has an ID, it can be expanded into a full object.

TweetFieldsParameter.description: A comma separated list of Tweet fields to display.

schema.description: The list of fields you can display for a [Tweet](#Tweet) object.

SinceIdRequestParameter.name: since_id
SinceIdRequestParameter.description: The minimum Tweet ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over start_time if both are specified.

UntilIdRequestParameter.name: until_id
UntilIdRequestParameter.description: The maximum Tweet ID to be included in the result set. This parameter takes precedence over end_time if both are specified.

PaginationTokenRequestParameter.name: pagination_token
PaginationTokenRequestParameter.description: This parameter is used to get the next 'page' of results.

SignedLongPaginationTokenRequestParamete.name: pagination_token
SignedLongPaginationTokenRequestParamete.description: This parameter is used to get a specified 'page' of results.

StartTimeRequestParameter.name: start_time
StartTimeRequestParameter.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The earliest UTC timestamp from which the Tweets will be provided. The since_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified.

EndTimeRequestParameter.name: end_time
EndTimeRequestParameter.description: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ssZ. The latest UTC timestamp to which the Tweets will be provided. The until_id parameter takes precedence if it is also specified.

TweetTypeExcludesRequestParameter.name: exclude
TweetTypeExcludesRequestParameter.description: The set of entities to exclude (e.g. 'replies' or 'retweets')

schema.description: The set of entities to exclude (e.g. 'replies' or 'retweets')

BackfillMinutesRequestParameter.name: backfill_minutes
BackfillMinutesRequestParameter.description: The number of minutes of backfill requested
